reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can A Betrothal Stop A Feud ? Can The Hate Turn To Love ?
reviews.reviewText: A Feud that lasted over 100 years with Hatred ands Violence ! With No Tolerance for another ! Even with a Betrothal Hoping for Peace . Nothing was stopping them ! Who was Sparking the Flames ? Why could it not stop ? There is plenty of Emotion, Excitement, Evil , and believe it or not Love ! A Story to keep you on the Edge !Noah Turner the Duke of Dulforth was sick and tired of all the conflict . It had gotten so out of hand with the violence that he suggested a Betrothal to unite the Families for Peace. The only problem was he hated the Hathcourts too. So how could he marry one and have children with them ?Albina Hathcourts was the daughter to the Marquess of Brenton . She was a Spinster. With know desire to marry or March to the rules of the Ton. Trousers and collard shirts were her attire of preference. She also hated the Turners. How could she marry one of them ?When Noah and Albina meet to discuss the Betrothal it is something that neither really want . They know that it is needed to try to end the conflict. To be a New Generation to take control ! With so much past and conflicting feelings it is hard to move forward. Family bucking them all the way. Will the family stop interfering ? Can they finally open up to each other ? Who is still trying to hurt them ? Lots of mysteries !What an Amazing Tale with two Screwed up Families ! It makes you Think and Wonder how such a conflict could last so long and keep festering with each generation ? A Definite Page Turner ! Fast Paced and Thrilling !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Albina and Noah
reviews.reviewText: A tale about a feud between two families, happening over several generations. An arranged marriage with a member from each family is decided, to help the reputations of both families in the ton. Albina, an independent thinker who prefers to not follow the expectations of the ton, causes hurdles for Noah, a rigid, rule follower driven to keep his dukedom elevated in the ton, and conduct a marriage of convenience only. Drama, betrayals, murder, secrets, and nefarious characters all play a role in reaching the major characters’ HEA. Eventually, clarity brings forth answers to the mysterious feud, nearing the end of the story.I did have concerns about major editing errors that includes missing words, misusing genders and stating someone was a sister versus a cousin, caused annoyance. It disrupts the flow of the story when I have to back up to re-read portions. I’m a huge fan of Ms Hamers, and the editing errors are usually a rarity for her. As I eagerly wait for her next book, I will hope she finds a better editor. :-) I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What an interesting read. It was hard to put it down. Family feud, history of love tragedy and sacrifice. Noah and Albina are determined to heal the rift but can they? Family betrayal and hatred keep the tension alive. Gang violence and killings enhance the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's Family Feud!
reviews.reviewText: I'm hoping that rivalries like these two families in the nobility occurred in the Renaissance, not in the Regency or Victorian era. Dueling was banned in 1844 and the last duel recorded was 1852. Otherwise, this story is well written and the climax is exciting. Although the epilogue is too long and makes it worse with an extended epilogue available to read online. The characters are well developed and it is established which family has the evil pushing the others in the family to behave with hatred. For Noah and Albina the union of their marriage takes on different aspects, until Albina makes him realize that whatever feelings are between them are real and override the family feud.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Learning to trust and love they enemies
reviews.reviewText: Great book! Noah and Albina decide to marry to end a feud between their families. But, can the hatred go dealer than either thought? While Albina wants her marriage to succeed and she discovered secrets not known to the family Noah is finding it hard to give into his desires for his wife. There are those against the marriage and will go to lengths to keep the secrets hidden even kidnapping and murder. This is a great book to get lost in the pages. Share with your friends, family and book clubs I'm sure they will love this book also! Enjoy!🍷

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Promising tale. Poorly executed
reviews.reviewText: The general concept of feuding families settling their long-time disagreements with a marriage intrigued me. Characterizations were well-developed and I liked the development I saw, especially in Albina. I found many of the couple's conflicts infuriatingly stupid - though it explains why the 2 families have been feuding for so long. Very promising tale with all the elements of a compelling readHowever, major editing is needed to fix the many grammatical errors, missing words, typos, and confusing sentences which grew more frequent as the book progressed. (One wrong name had a character making love to his cousin, not his wife!) Greater attention to detail is needed. (Man completely undresses his wife at the top of the stairs!?) More research into the regency era's law enforcement procedures and attitudes toward titled nobility need to be done... An untitled noble "accidentally" harms a duchess and he's merely fined? A duke and a marquess sent outside England in the protective custody of the crown??? Frankly, the final 3 chapters AND the extended epilogue should be eliminated and replaced with a few paragraphs that tie up the story and provide a quick happily ever after.A story with much promise, but not quite ready for prime time, IMO.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A really good story in itself but there are so many typos and grammatical errors that it stopped the flow of the story. The mixed up pronouns were confusing at times. I loved the characters. The plot didn’t drag on like some tend to do and become frustrating for me so that’s probably the main reason I kept reading. It really would be a well written story if there had been better editing. Violet is one of my favorite authors!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: TWO PEOPLE TAUGHT ALL THEIR LIVES TO BE ENEMIES - CAN THEY STOP HURTING EACH OTHER
reviews.reviewText: NOAH TURNER DUKE - Is angry when his youngest brother injured youngest brother is seriouslyinjured in a fight with the their enemies the Hathcourts , his brothers and uncles want to fight them start yet another war Noah does not want this he decides an alternative arrangement.The Harcourts have one daughter he is proposing he marry the daughter which will stop the wars between the two families - his family are against this he sees this as the only way.ALBINA HARCOURT is youngest child and only daughter free to do as she pleases her brothers treat her as a boy- TOTALLY uncontrollable and uneducated in etiquette determined to remain a spinster - more a tomboy than a young lady runs around in trousers climbing trees.I REALLY ENJOYED THIS - BRILLIANT STORY LOTS GOING ON - DID NOT LIKE NOAH BUT THEN CHANGED MY MIND QUITE STEAMY.My ONE CRITICISM WAS THE EXTENDED EPILOGUEWent on and on just did not see the need for the entire family move and all the safe houses.LOVED THIS STORY BRILLIANTI received an ARC copy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: When Families Are Feeding Can They Survive?
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this story. It had a lot of unexpected twists and turns. A feud between two families had lasted for over one hundred years. Could they find a way to end the feud? Albina and Noah marry to try to settle the tension between the famiIies. However, their own feelings of tension threaten to keep them apart. Other family members find it hard to forget the feud and tensions run high. The story has stabbings, abduction and a lot of danger before Noah and Albina are able to find a settled life and happiness. There were some typing errors but not enough to detract from the story. Read on and enjoy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was a nice romantic tale with some twists and turns to keep you guessing, but the spelling mistakes and wrong or missing words were bad! Especially the later part of the book.
